dublinCore.title: 113 S786 IS: Restoring Honesty for our Economy Act

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Roberts introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To require agencies to quantify costs associated with proposed economically significant regulations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring Honesty for our Economy Act .

paragraph.text: the term agency means any authority of the United States that is—

subparagraph.text: an agency as defined under section 3502(1) of title 44, United States Code; and
shall include an independent regulatory agency as defined under section 3502(5) of title 44, United States Code;

means an agency statement of general applicability and future effect, which the agency intends to have the force and effect of law, that is designed to implement, interpret, or prescribe law or policy or to describe the procedure or practice requirements of an agency; and

clause.text: a regulation issued in accordance with the formal rulemaking provisions of sections 556 and 557 of title 5, United States Code;

a regulation that pertains to a military or foreign affairs function of the United States, other than procurement regulations and regulations involving the import or export of non-defense articles and services; or

paragraph.text: the term economically significant regulation means any regulation that—

subparagraph.text: has an annual effect on the economy of $100,000,000 or more; or

adversely affects in a material way the economy, a sector of the economy, productivity, competition, jobs, the environment, public health or safety, or State, local, or tribal governments or communities.

section.header: Finalization of proposed economically significant regulations
section.text: A proposed economically significant regulation may not be finalized unless the proposed economically significant regulation—

paragraph.text: identifies and quantifies all costs associated with the proposed economically significant regulation; or
describes why it is not possible for the agency to identify or quantify all costs associated with the proposed economically significant regulation.

section.text: Any person may file a petition for judicial review of the agency action required under section 3 within the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit or for the circuit in which such person resides or in which such person's principal place of business is located. Courts of appeals of the United States shall have exclusive jurisdiction of any action to obtain judicial review (other than in an enforcement proceeding) of such an action if any district court of the United States would have had jurisdiction of such action but for this section.
